text:
Hey Simon! Nice for us to to be connected :relaxed:. Some goals I have in mind is just pretty much figuring out where to get a start into doing illustration and animation (2D as a start). I want to learn more about the industry and what it has to offer. So would like to have some ground knowledge and work up from there.

I don’t know if you are aware but I don’t really have a background in this area. In terms of educational or professional background, but, I am really motivated in channeling my interest in the industry to a career. Just would like some guidance and advice on how to get started. 


I haven’t got much of a background 

actually have no background in animation or illustration so I do feel kind of out of place. But I aspire to become an animator/illustrator just thought this would be a good place for me to start.
Hey Bernice - this is the perfect place to start!
A good place to start would be Blender, it's free software and there are lots of tutorials available online.

We shared this 'call to action' following our recent 3-day animation summer school, which covers the link to download the software and get connected to a specific summer school mailing list: <https://www.accessvfx.org/school>
What level of study are you at currently?
Have a read of this too: <https://www.accessvfx.org/blog/tips-for-finding-your-first-role-in-vfx>
This is worth a look too: <https://www.accessvfx.org/blog/a-step-by-step-guide-to-starting-in-vfx>

I’m actually a university student. But studying psychology  and business. I kind of went through the realisation that it isn’t the right course for me and I am meant for somethings more creative. 

I’ve always appreciated animation and cartoons. Then realised that this for makes sense for me to do with my life.

Thanks you! I’ll give them a look!

I was actually interested in attending the animation summer school to get a feel but realised that I may be a little too old for it:relaxed:
